intro: Themeda trichiata, commonly known as spear grass, is a perennial grass species native to Australia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Poaceae family. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Themeda trichiata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various native animals.
